La grafica è pessima, ok la pixel art ma qui quasi non si capisce cosa succede a schermo.

185443562.review:
----------
Overview
----------

An interesting concept, with intriguing visuals.
Unfortunately, the game mechanics are sloppy, non-responsive garbage, and seem heavily dependant on RNG factors.
This game would be better off as either a protesters vs. police themed UEBS (Ultimate Epic Battle Simulator) or a screensaver/desktop background for something like Wallpaper Engine.

--------
Details
--------

For some reason, protesters are far more motivated and capable of charging a wall of shields, batons and aggression than they are trying to get past a few scattered cops with single-shot teargas launchers and little else.

There might be massive gaps between the ballistics police that any person with half and brain and a pair of legs could WALK through, or around, yet the protesters will instead flee and completely ignore anything you tell them to do. If you play like 4 missions, you'll quickly get to this point, and be unable to proceed any further. You can go full defensive, you can go full offensive, you can go full passivity, or full violence, it doesn't matter.

The devs explain that when the game "becomes too difficult" that you just need to go back and replay the previous missions over and over "with different strategies" to boost your "publicity advantage".

Despite being unable to unlock any of these "different strategies" (because you can't complete that one awful mission), you roll your eyes and replay the previous missions a few more times as recommended.

But then, irrespective of completing the previous missions repeatedly with "perfect victory" being the result for each instance, the aforementioned "publicity advantage" will instead DECREASE, making it even LESS likely for you to complete that one mission.

I'm assuming you just need to keep replaying that same terrible mission over and over until the RNG is in your favor, but why bother? If you're relying so much on RNG in a game to determine the outcome of action, instead of conscious decisions or strategy, it may as well be a simulation, not a game.

You can keep spamming hotkeys and repeatedly ordering your groups to move or act, and they'll just ignore you or any actual opportunities to be of any use, simply because there is some arbitrary or vaporous instruction in the background keeping you from proceeding unless you're boosting play time statistics.

On top of the nonsensical instructions and game mechanics, the UI is also poorly executed. The lack of responsiveness both in-game and in-menu is frustrating. Having to wait 5 minutes for the game to tally my score at the end of every match, without being able to skip or speed up the process, is just stupid.

184703478.review:
实话实说犹豫了很久，但是最后还是决定不推荐。
最重要的理由，它不好玩。某种程度上说，这个游戏基本上没啥游戏性。绝大多数关卡都可以用固定操作模式获胜，如果没有，那就再重复一次。少有的稍微有策略点的地方，也就是用车堵一下门。最有“策略”的一关居然是骆驼之战，而所谓策略就是社区里一位大佬的方法——除了那个固定的套路，我确实想不到还有什么别的方法能稍微稳定点地和平过那关。
单调的玩法导致虽然看似设置了很多玩法、模式，全球里放了很多关卡，但是游戏流程单调又乏味，特殊人物有和没有没啥区别。大概15小时左右就能玩完所有东西，拿到所有成就。很多可以开发的东西完全没有发掘，控制手感非常糟糕，让我一度怀疑这个游戏到底有没有为电脑键盘的键位设计过。
这个游戏好的地方也挺多，美术风格不错，音乐能做到这个程度也很不错，题材也很有趣。如果这是个视频，用来记录作者所见所闻，我会很乐意给出好评。但是这是个游戏，作者既希望有一定的交互性，但是又想保留自己所见的东西，结果就是玩家操作半天感觉自己对局势影响有限，但是因为交互的问题，又不能有效反映现实。
我知道这个游戏是由一个非常小的工作室制作的，我理解制作游戏的困难，这也是我在推荐与不推荐之间犹豫的原因之一。但是现在都发售近6年了，中文的游戏界面里部分画面居然还有文字显示不全的问题，我估计作者也不计划改了。游戏性差可能是作者梦里有限，这种明显影响体验的小问题都不改，我不能接受。
抛开游戏性而言，这个作品也有点令人失望。它用现实事例做关卡，但是又没有详细讲述事件过程。游戏设置了政治评分，但是却主要展现冲突的画面。对于一个严重的社会事件而言，单纯描述冲突过于肤浅，导致我玩的时候经常在想：上一关不是还挺平和的吗？怎么突然打起来了？
以及，作者的政治倾向很明确，更支持抗议者那边（不得不吐槽一下，游戏里的中文翻译是“暴徒”，这个词有一点贬义，但是作者话里话外又在支持，显然翻译做的不够好。因此此处我用了“抗议者”这个词）。我最初以为能看到什么公正客观的详细分析，最后看到的却是没有分析，全是作者的个人情感。
最后的结论就是：除非对这类题材的游戏有收集的兴趣爱好，否则别买。逛逛这游戏的社区得了，这游戏的社区比游戏好玩多了。
